intro: Linociera angolensis, commonly known as the Angola linociera, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
